section.title: What is Wireshark?
section.para: Wireshark is the world's most popular network protocol analyzer. It is used for troubleshooting, analysis, development, and education.

section.title: Bug Fixes
section.para:
The following vulnerabilities have been fixed. See the security advisory for details and a workaround.
The TCP dissector could hang or crash while reassembling HTTP packets.
Versions affected: 0.99.2 to 0.99.4
The HTTP dissector could crash.
Versions affected: 0.99.3 to 0.99.4
On some systems, the IEEE 802.11 dissector could crash.
Versions affected: 0.10.14 to 0.99.4
On some systems, the LLT dissector could crash.
Versions affected: 0.99.3 to 0.99.4

The following bugs have been fixed:
On Windows systems the packet list scroll bar could sometimes disappear or become unusable. (Bug 220)
The end of HTTP chunked encoding wasn't being displayed. (Bug 646)
The Follow TCP Stream window could omit characters. (Bug 1043)
Opening a flow graph could crash Wireshark. (Bug 1117)
Follow TCP Stream would sometimes get the direction wrong. (Bug 1138)
The foreground text in the coloring rules editor was always black.. (Bug 1164)
The CSV export format was incorrect. (Bug 1173)
On some Windows systems Wireshark could take a long time to start up.

section.title: New and Updated Features
section.para:
The following features are new (or have been significantly updated) since the last release:
WPA and WPA2 decryption support has been added. The TDS / MS SQL dissector now de-obfuscates passwords.
64-bit file handling has been improved.
The Find function now selects the corresponding. packet detail item.
Find functionality has been added to the TCP and SSL stream dialogs.
Main window keyboard navigation has been improved.
SNMPv3 decryption.
AirPcap support (which provides raw mode capture under Windows) has been enhanced to allow capturing on multiple AirPcap adapters simultaneously using the Multi-Channel Aggregator.
You can no longer install Wireshark on Windows 95, 98, or ME. (OK, so it's not a feature per seߪ)

section.title: Getting Wireshark
section.para: Wireshark source code and installation packages are available from the download page on the main web site.

section.title: Vendor-supplied Packages
section.para: Most Linux and Unix vendors supply their own Wireshark packages. You can usually install or upgrade Wireshark using the package management system specific to that platform. A list of third-party packages can be found on the download page on the Wireshark web site.

section.title: File Locations
section.para: Wireshark and TShark look in several different locations for preference files, plugins, SNMP MIBS, and RADIUS dictionaries. These locations vary from platform to platform. You can use About->Folders to find the default locations on your system.

section.title: Known Problems
section.para: The Filter button is nonfunctional in the file dialogs under Windows. (Bug 942)

section.title: Getting Help
section.para: Community support is available on the wireshark-users mailing list. Subscription information and archives for all of Wireshark's mailing lists can be found on the web site.
Commercial support, training, and development services are available from CACE Technologies.
